tk.gjz010.machinebukkit.api

Interface Machine

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.bukkit.event.Listener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseMachine, ContainerMachine, TestMachine

    public interface Machine
extends org.bukkit.event.Listener
    The super interface of all the machines.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doWorking()
      doWorking is called when the machine is working.
      org.bukkit.block.Block getBaseBlock()
      getBaseBlock returns the base of the machine.
      org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getFromHopper()
      getFromHopper tells the server what to get from the inventory to hopper.Not implemented yet.
      Machine getInstance(org.bukkit.block.Block base, org.bukkit.block.Sign sign)
      getInstance returns a instance of the machine.It creates a instance and call setBaseAndSign().
      org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin getPlugin()
      getPlugin gets the base Plugin.
      void getRecipe()
      getRecipe tells how to build the machine.
      org.bukkit.block.Sign getSignBlock()
      getSignBlock returns the sign of the machine.
      java.lang.String getType()
      getType is the type of the machine.It's written on the second line of the sign.
      void load(java.io.File file)
      load loads the machine state from a file.
      void onDestoryed()
      onDestoryed is called when the machine is destoryed.
      void onMachineCreated(MachineCreateEvent e)
      onMachineCreated is called when MachineListener calls a MachineCreateEvent.
      void save(java.io.File file)
      save saves the machine state to a file.
      void setBaseAndSign(org.bukkit.block.Block base, org.bukkit.block.Sign sign)
      setBaseAndSign sets the machine location.
      void setPlugin(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
      setPlugin sets the base Plugin.
      void setToHopper(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack i)
      setToHopper tells the server how to deal with the item from the hopper.Not implemented yet.

      • getInstance

        Machine getInstance(org.bukkit.block.Block base,
                  org.bukkit.block.Sign sign)
        getInstance returns a instance of the machine.It creates a instance and call setBaseAndSign().
        Parameters:
        base - The base block of the machine.
        sign - The sign of the machine.
        Returns:
        A new instance of the registered machine.
        See Also:
        setBaseAndSign(Block base,Sign sign)

      • getPlugin

        getPlugin gets the base Plugin.
        Returns:
